title: Ambulance driver facing jail for running over and killing man on way to 999 call
text:
An ambulance driver is facing jail for knocking down pedestrian on way to 999 call in Stratton Way, Oxon (Picture: Google Maps)

An Ambulance driver has admitted causing death by dangerous driving after hitting a man on a pedestrian crossing while answering a 999 call.

Angus McCullock, 23, is facing jail for killing 64-year-old Adrian Hesford in Oxon.

He changed his plea at a second court hearing after initially denying the charges.

The case has been adjourned for a report with sentencing due to take place next month.

Prosecutor Richard Milne said that the Crown accepted the guilty plea to causing death by careless driving and said it was not necessary to proceed to trial.

He said that because the incident took place while ‘part of his duties as an ambulance driver’ as well as an ‘emotive’ letter on behalf of the victim’s brother, there was no public interest in a trial.
